# Introduction

A **survey** is a systematic method for gathering information from <font color = "red">**\color{red}a sample of**</font>  entities (subjects) for the purposes of constructing quantitative descriptors of the attributes of the larger population of which the entities are members. 

**Surveys** are conducted to gather information from the entities/subjects in the sample that reflects populationâ€™s characteristics that cannot be observed directly.

We have introduced the several probability sampling methods to collect samples from a study population.
